# duration

**Instance Property**

The total playback time of the animation.

## Declaration

```swift
var duration: TimeInterval { get }
```

## Discussion

The framework sets a value for this property depending on the underlying animation data and the specified [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/speed].

You can override the default duration by defining [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimStart], [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimEnd], or [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimDuration].

## Timing the animation

- **speed**: A factor that increases or decreases the animation’s rate of playback.
- **delay**: An amount of time that lapses before the animation plays.
- **offset**: The time, in seconds, at which the animation begins within the duration.
- **trimDuration**: An optional duration that overrides the calculated duration.
- **trimStart**: The time, in seconds, at which the source animation plays.
- **trimEnd**: The time, in seconds, at which the source animation stops.
